tweet: Americans are rejecting the Democratic Party. They’re turning to the Republican Party because we will protect and restore the American Dream, for every American. We will govern with strength, pride, and honor, just as Reagan did.

label: right
tweet: The American Dream has been secured by those, generation after generation, willing to endure the nightmare of war. We do not seek conflict, but we do not shrink from it either. So long as our enemies know this, we will keep the peace.

label: right
tweet: Our troops fight for the flag on their shoulder and the buddies to their left and right. They don’t fight for abstractions like the “rules-based international order,” or “diversity,” or “climate change."

label: right
tweet: Putin wagered that if the American president wouldn’t stand up to a depraved gang of seventh-century savages in Afghanistan, there was no way he would stand up to Russia.

label: right
tweet: The Republican Party must always remain the party of work, protecting the opportunity to work, the dignity of work, and the value of work.

label: right
tweet: For too long, our leaders have adopted short-term and short-sighted economic policies, selling off the inheritance of our ancestors for short-lived profit. We’ve been governed from quarter to quarter—as if America is a corporation, not a nation. This era must come to an end.

label: right
tweet: Free trade isn’t free unless it flows both ways. China isn’t engaged in free trade, not even close.

label: right
tweet: China’s entry into the WTO in 2001 began a hollowing out of America’s industrial base, economy, and working class. Many states, like mine, have lost a quarter of their manufacturing jobs. Factories closed, families splintered, and opportunities crumbled.

label: right
tweet: Both parties are complicit in one of the single worst mistakes of this generation: granting Communist China Permanent Most Favored Nation status and admitting it into the World Trade Organization.

label: right
tweet: We must invest more in American workers, pay them more, and treat them better. The days of importing their replacements must come to an end.

label: right
tweet: The right amount of illegal immigration is zero.

label: right
tweet: But the level of immigration—legal and illegal—has been too high for too long. And too many immigrants come here without needed skills or any means of support. They’re admitted instead by the random chance of geographic proximity or family connections.

label: right
tweet: Many immigrants are our greatest patriots, leaving behind impoverished, dangerous, and unfree countries for this land of hope. America takes great pride in them, their accomplishments, and their attachment to our shared nation.

label: right
tweet: We must reject the ideology of globalism, which claims that wide-open borders and wide-open markets are the path to prosperity for all. America’s shuttered factories, boarded-up main streets, and derelict drug dens stand as grim monuments that rebuke this theory.

label: right
tweet: The phrase “America First” gives the vapors to globalists in both parties, partly because of its World War Two-era disrepute, but to the Jacksonian ear, it sounds like simple, obvious common sense. If we don’t put America first, who will?

label: right
tweet: That starts with a basic truth rejected by Democrats and, unfortunately, too many Republicans: we are a nation with an economy, not an economy with a nation. We are a people with principles, not a set of principles with a people.

label: right
tweet: We must rebuild an economy that works for all citizens, especially the forgotten men and women left behind by decades of open borders, unfettered trade, and globalization.

label: right
tweet: Our party should reverse this and once again put hardened, career criminals where they belong—back behind bars.

label: right
tweet: For four years, I led the fight against the First Step Act, when nearly everyone was on the other side, including former President Trump, in the worst mistake of his tenure.

label: right
tweet: No piece of legislation did more to harm Republicans' status as the party of public safety than the First Step Act.

label: right
tweet: They’ve contributed to the worst increase in murder rates on record and the most drug-overdose deaths ever. There’s only one answer to these radicals: Republicans must work to recall, remove, and replace every last Soros prosecutor.

label: right
tweet: In many Democratic-run cities, prosecutors refuse to prosecute. These “progressive” or “Soros prosecutors” haven’t just abused prosecutorial discretion, they’ve embraced prosecutorial nullification, ruling entire categories of serious crimes out of bounds for prosecution.

label: right
tweet: Here, too, Democrats have abandoned the American people—especially our most vulnerable citizens.

label: right
tweet: Along with protecting our liberty and preserving it for our posterity, our founders also understood that protecting our people from violence, crime, and the breakdown of law and order is another chief responsibility for the government.

label: right
tweet: Republicans are the party of opportunity, achievement, and excellence for all. We’ll keep schools open, involve parents as partners in their kid’s education, teach kids the skills they need, and restore patriotic education.

tweet: Republicans must protect America’s kids from left-wing madness. As Reagan understood, a nation cannot long survive if its schoolchildren don’t learn basic skills but do learn to hate their country.

tweet: We shouldn’t be cowed by a dishonest media that conspires with the Democrats and Big Tech to cancel, censor, and smear normal Americans.

label: right
tweet: The Democratic Party has abandoned the soul of Jacksonian Democracy, grounded in a deep and simple love of country, community, and American culture. They have cast aside those attributes embodied by the likes of Jackson and Washington: duty, honor, loyalty.

label: right
tweet: For nearly two centuries, Democratic Party faithful celebrated President Jackson, seeing themselves as the party of the common man aligned against the forces of wealth and inherited power. Not anymore.

label: right
tweet: Ronald Reagan understood what every Republican officeholder must remember: we are elected first and foremost to protect the American people, their prosperity, and their freedom.

tweet: I joined  on a bill to protect airline passengers and crew from toxic fumes. We need to protect everyone who flies from unnecessary exposure to these fumes and ensure all flights are safe.

tweet: The shooting in Sacramento this weekend isn’t an isolated event. It’s the latest in an epidemic of gun violence that continues to plague our country. Enough is enough. Congress knows what steps must be taken to stop these mass shootings, we just have to act.

tweet: My heart breaks for those who lost loved ones in last night’s shooting in Sacramento. This is another reminder that the gun violence epidemic continues to plague our country. It’s long past time for commonsense gun safety laws.

tweet: ! Wishing everyone observing in California and around the country a joyous and peaceful month.

tweet: Trans rights are human rights, plain and simple. I’m proud to support the trans community in the fight for equality. Hateful and bigoted attempts to marginalize anyone for living their life must not and will not stand.

tweet: I’m proud to cosponsor ’s bill to tax oil companies, which are reaping record profits from high oil prices while production costs remain the same. We need to be putting money in the pockets of hardworking Americans, not giant corporations.

tweet: Reduced water inflow is causing the Salton Sea to shrink, and this is exposing toxic elements including arsenic and selenium. The administration needs to work to restore the nearly 9 square miles of federally owned land and prevent toxic dust from affecting local communities.

tweet: President Biden’s budget expands on his promise to invest in the American people. As we recover from the Covid-19 pandemic, the president’s budget will help reduce inflation, strengthen our economy and ensure the rich pay their fair share in taxes.

tweet: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s poise, intellect and expertise were on full display last week during her nomination hearings. After reviewing Judge Jackson’s record, I have no doubt she will make an outstanding justice.

tweet: The United States lost today an elder statesman and towering figure in the field of foreign relations. I was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of Secretary Albright, a woman who lived an amazing life and was an inspiration to so many.

tweet: Far too often offshore oil drilling has resulted in the destruction of ecosystems and degradation of California’s pristine coastline. As I keep working to pass legislation at the federal level, I’m calling on the California Senate to pass SB953 to ban drilling in state waters.

tweet: The landmark Affordable Care Act was signed into law 12 years ago today. It allowed millions of Americans to secure health coverage who were previously uninsured. I was proud to support this legislation and will continue working to protect and improve it.

tweet: While all eyes this week are rightfully focused on Judge Jackson’s Supreme Court nomination, we’re still working to confirm well-qualified judges to all federal courts. Today we confirmed Judge Ruth Montenegro to serve on the Southern District of California. This is great news!

tweet: In Judge Jackson’s eight years as a district court judge, she issued 578 opinions. Only 14 of those were reversed on appeal, or 2.4%. That’s far lower than the 9% national average for district court judges. She’s extremely qualified to serve on the Supreme Court.

label: left
tweet: Justices Gorsuch, Kavanaugh and Barrett in their confirmation hearings all recognized the importance of upholding precedent. The right to abortion has been reaffirmed repeatedly and is established precedent. Listen to Judge Jackson share her thoughts on the right to abortion:

tweet: Judge Jackson’s nomination has the support of law enforcement organizations, including the International Association of Chiefs of Police. She also comes from a law enforcement family. Listen to her talk about how being the sister and niece of police officers has influenced her:

tweet: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson has authored nearly 600 opinions over nine years as a federal judge. She’s an evenhanded, impartial jurist and if confirmed, will make a strong Supreme Court justice. Her remarkable record speaks for itself.

label: left
tweet: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson has been confirmed by the Senate on three occasions for three different positions in the federal judiciary on a bipartisan basis. It’s clear that she’s more than qualified to be the next Supreme Court justice.

label: left
tweet: Throughout Judge Jackson’s tenure on the federal bench, she has proven to be a jurist in the mold of Justice Breyer. In nearly 600 opinions, she has shown an evenhanded approach to cases, applying the law fairly and impartially.

label: left
tweet: A wide range of individuals and organizations have endorsed Judge Jackson’s nomination to the Supreme Court.Conservative legal scholars, law enforcement groups, labor unions, civil rights organizations and more all support her nomination.

label: left
tweet: Today the Senate Judiciary Committee begins hearings on Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s nomination to the Supreme Court. I look forward to hearing more about Judge Jackson’s exceptional record, legal views and expertise. She is a remarkably qualified nominee.

tweet: California’s district courts have some of the highest caseloads in the country. Adding these two highly qualified judges to the courts will help alleviate some of the strain.

tweet: Judges Corley and Slaughter will make excellent additions to California’s district courts and we’re pleased the Senate has confirmed them. We supported their nominations because they both bring a wealth of experience to the federal bench.

label: left
tweet: We can all see that climate change is making droughts much worse for California. I’m pleased that we’re finally on the verge of constructing several major storage projects. Sites Reservoir is the largest and will significantly benefit our water system.

label: left
tweet: I enjoyed my discussion with Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson yesterday. She is a remarkable nominee and will make a very strong Supreme Court justice.

tweet: I spoke on the Senate floor this morning about the recently reauthorized Violence Against Women Act. After years of hard work and bipartisan negotiations, we finally got it done. Watch my speech here:

tweet: The rise in violence against Asian Americans is unacceptable and intolerable. On the one-year anniversary of the Atlanta spa shootings, we must all recommit to stamping out bigotry in all forms and do all we can do secure passage for gun-safety reform bills.

tweet: This war has killed thousands and more than 3 million Ukrainians have already fled their country. We must do all we can to end the suffering and make sure Vladimir Putin understands this is not a war he can win.

label: left
tweet: I support President Zelenskyy’s requests for advanced defensive weaponry and believe the United States must continue to lead the way in bringing international diplomatic and economic pressure to bear on Russia to end this war.

label: left
tweet: President Zelenskyy this morning brought home the suffering of the Ukrainian people and the ruthless, unprovoked aggression by Russia. The United States has stood with Ukraine, providing critical support for defensive and humanitarian needs, and we must continue that partnership.

label: left
tweet: Today is the 74th day of the year. That’s how many more days a woman has to work in 2022 to match the average salary a man earned in 2021. This is why we must pass the Paycheck Fairness Act as soon as possible.

label: left
tweet: Thanks to President Biden for signing our Methamphetamine Response Act into law last night. Methamphetamine overdoses have soared in recent years, and this legislation will direct the Office of National Drug Control Policy to develop and implement a plan to address this crisis.

label: left
tweet: The bill also includes $45 billion for Energy Department programs to fight climate change, expand renewable energy programs, conduct research at national laboratories and universities, improve cybersecurity capabilities and continue nuclear nonproliferation efforts.

label: left
tweet: I’m pleased that the federal spending bill will help modernize our water infrastructure. This includes more than $10 billion for the Corps of Engineers and Bureau of Reclamation to complete water infrastructure projects, many that will help California better respond to drought.

label: left
tweet: The bill also includes $4 billion in humanitarian aid to help the more than 2 million people who have already fled Ukraine as well as the millions more who have been internally displaced. I’m glad that Congress is stepping in to help these people whose lives have been shattered.

label: left
tweet: The war in Ukraine is a tragedy. It's a Russian war of aggression that benefits no one, but it does require a strong response from the United States. I’m proud that the funding bill we passed last week will provide $3.5 billion for military equipment for Ukraine to defend itself.

label: left
tweet: From rapid economic growth and job creation to falling Covid cases and expanding health care, the American Rescue Plan has been an undeniable success. I’m confident we’ll continue to see its positive effects for years to come.

label: left
tweet: California received nearly $27 billion and local California governments received nearly $16 billion. The law lowered health care costs for millions, put money back into parent’s pockets through the Child Tax Credit and provided billions to help small businesses.

label: left
tweet: President Biden’s American Rescue Plan was signed into law one year ago and its positive effect on California is undeniable. It led to the fastest economic growth in 40 years, largest increase in jobs on record and lowered the unemployment rate to 3.8%.

label: left
tweet: I applaud  for leading the House introduction of our bill to create a bipartisan commission of experts to investigate what went right and wrong during our response to Covid. This pandemic won’t be the last, so we must learn from this one to prepare for the next.

label: left
tweet: Senators are elected to debate issues and to vote. They’re not elected to skip meetings critical to the functioning of our government. I encourage my Republican colleagues to stop these political games. If they oppose a nominee, vote no. Don’t hamstring our government.

label: left
tweet: Five nominees to the Federal Reserve Board are awaiting action in the Banking Committee because Republicans will not attend meetings to provide a quorum. As we emerge from this pandemic and face a destabilizing war in Ukraine, it’s not the time to play games with our economy.

label: left
tweet: The recent Republican practice of boycotting Senate committee hearings to prevent votes on well-qualified Biden nominees needs to stop. It's a dangerous precedent and is dismissive of the duties for which we were sent to Washington.

label: left
tweet: Homelessness is a big problem in California, and any solution must address the underlying causes of homelessness. This bill does that by investing in programs including housing, training, counseling and mental health services.

label: left
tweet: As wildfires become more frequent and severe due to climate change, we can’t afford to have a firefighter shortage. Paying federal wildland firefighters more and ensuring they’re paid for overtime they earned will help recruit and retain a skilled workforce.

tweet: The Senate last night passed legislation that provides significant funding for wildfire mitigation and recovery, drought resiliency, anti-homelessness initiatives, environmental priorities and more. It’s an excellent bill for California. Read more here:

tweet: I’m grateful our bipartisan bill to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act passed the Senate last night. This is a major advancement to protect women from domestic violence and sexual assault – a tragedy faced by one in three women in this country.

tweet: Members of our armed forces should never worry that they can’t afford to put food on their tables. I’m proud to join  in introducing a bill to ensure all our active duty service members and their families don’t go hungry.

label: left
tweet: While great progress has been made, we’re still a long way from true equality. It’s my hope that future generations will look back on these accomplishments and be inspired to make the world a better place for all.

tweet: The Senate this week passed a resolution I introduced with  designating March as . It pays tribute to the extraordinary accomplishments of past generations of American women.

label: left
tweet: I applaud the Biden administration for restoring California’s authority to set its own, stronger vehicle emissions standards. California set 2035 as the target by which all vehicles sold must be zero-emission. The restoration of this waiver will help make that goal a reality.

label: left
tweet: California has long been a leader in clean air and climate policy, working with auto manufacturers to set and achieve ambitious environmental goals that protect public health, safeguard clean air and save money for consumers.

label: left
tweet: I’m glad the Senate passed the Postal Service Reform Act. It will put the Postal Service on a more sound financial footing and ensure that USPS will continue to deliver mail and packages at least six days a week.

label: left
tweet: I’m pleased that our bipartisan bill to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act is in this week’s omnibus. It was written in partnership with those working in our communities to support survivors and I’m glad it’s finally going to pass. It’s long overdue.

label: left
tweet: After more than a century of trying, the Senate last night passed legislation to make lynching a federal hate crime. The passage of this legislation is long overdue and I’m glad to see it finally get done.

label: left
tweet: This is a commonsense approach to prevent prospective gun buyers from evading background checks by secretly buying weapons online.

label: left
tweet: Despite bans by major technology companies on using their platforms to sell firearms, many sites are struggling to stop dishonest individuals from selling guns online. Our bill would make it clear that it’s a crime to circumvent a website’s terms of service to sell a firearm.

label: left
tweet: From reducing greenhouse gas emissions to hardening infrastructure against extreme weather, fighting climate change must be at the forefront of Washington’s agenda. I’m proud to have received a 100% score on the 2021 League of Conservation Voters scorecard.

label: left
tweet: Women have made tremendous progress since I entered the Senate. More women serve in Congress now than any time in our history and we elected our first woman vice president. We have a long way to go, but I’m proud of the progress we’ve made as we recognize .

label: left
tweet: California has been the center for innovation and cutting edge research for decades. The R&D tax credit is vital for this work, which is why I joined a bipartisan group of my colleagues in calling for this tax credit to be reinstated.

label: left
tweet: We’re urging Attorney General Garland to prioritize the investigation and prosecution of hate crimes. There’s been an increase in hate crimes across the country over the last few years and we must do more to seek justice for all.

label: left
tweet: President Biden last week signed into law legislation to end forced arbitration clauses for cases of sexual assault and sexual harassment. These clauses protect predators and prevent survivors from seeking justice. I’m glad to see the bill become law.

label: left
tweet: This legislation was inspired by the strength and courage of the gymnasts who brought to light the horrific abuses perpetrated by Larry Nassar. I’m glad the Senate passed our bill to allow survivors to seek justice without arbitrary statutes of limitations.

label: left
tweet: The atrocities Vladimir Putin is committing in Ukraine are war crimes, plain and simple. Our resolution calls for Putin and other Russian leaders to be held accountable for this tragedy, especially the targeting of Ukrainian civilians.

label: left
tweet: 740 organizations working to end domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault and stalking called on the Senate to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act. These groups on the frontlines know how important this legislation is.

label: left
tweet: Thank you  for highlighting the need to pass our bipartisan reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act last night.

label: left
tweet: I support Governor Newsom’s order that CalPERS, CalSTRS & other state retirement systems halt all investments in Russia & purchase of Russian debt, as well as assess future risk to retirees. Russia’s war in Ukraine is unacceptable and California won’t reward such aggression.

label: left
tweet: On Monday, the Senate will vote on the Women’s Health Protection Act, a bill to protect women’s access to abortion care. As abortion rights come under attack across the country, Congress must pass this bill and codify the right to choose.

label: left
tweet: If confirmed, she would become the first former federal public defender to serve on the Supreme Court. She has been confirmed by the Senate three times, as recently as last year with bipartisan support. I look forward to productive hearings before the Judiciary Committee soon.

label: left
tweet: This is a historic nomination. Judge Jackson is the first Black woman to be nominated to the Supreme Court and she embodies President Biden’s commitment to ensuring that the federal judiciary is representative of America as a whole.

label: left
tweet: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson is indisputably well qualified to serve on the Supreme Court. She currently serves as a federal appellate judge on the D.C. Circuit Court and before that spent eight years as a federal district judge on the D.C. District Court.

label: left
tweet: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is an unprovoked attack with no justification, and it is incumbent on all nations to ensure that Putin and his government are met with severe consequences. Putin must understand that such aggression will not stand.

label: left
tweet: Californians know the reality of extreme wildfires all too well. We need to reduce the risk of wildfire by passing legislation like the Wildfire Emergency Act to help harden infrastructure, train personnel and conduct large-scale forest restoration projects.

label: left
tweet: A new UN report estimates that even with significant reductions in carbon emissions, the world will still experience an increase of extreme wildfires in the coming decades. As we address the root causes of climate change, we must help communities prepare.

label: left
tweet: The Community Advantage program has helped launch businesses, create jobs, and drive innovation across our nation. We are extending the program until 2024—expanding the number of lenders in the program and increasing the amount of money they can lend.

label: left
tweet: Here’s the bottom line: When small business owners have the support they need, they create jobs, drive and inspire innovation, and grow our entire economy.

label: left
tweet: Last year, the deficit fell by over $350 billion.We are building a better America.

label: left
tweet: America and our economy are driven by the ambition and aspiration of our small businesses.

label: left
tweet: Billionaires shouldn’t pay a lower tax rate than working Americans.

label: left
tweet: Lynching is not a relic of the past. We must acknowledge the horror in this part of our history. We must unequivocally state that lynching is and always has been a hate crime.The Emmett Till Antilynching Act does just that.

label: left
tweet: Three years ago, I co-led an effort to make lynching a federal hate crime, and it passed the Senate by unanimous consent.The Emmett Till Antilynching Act is now law for the first time after 200 tries over more than 100 years.

label: left
tweet: Victims of lynching were targeted. They were business owners, teachers, activists—all working to build a better America. We recognize them and that history with the Emmett Till Antilynching Act.

label: left
tweet: Emmett Till was murdered in 1955. He was only 14 years old. Lynching is a dark and despicable part of our nation’s history, and now we’re one step closer to bringing justice to victims and their families with the Emmett Till Antilynching Act being signed into law.

label: left
tweet: President Biden and I will continue to fight for the right to vote by pushing Congress to pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.Together, we can safeguard and strengthen the freedom to vote for generations to come.

label: left
tweet: Thanks to President  and President , the Affordable Care Act has made health care accessible for millions of Americans—no matter your gender, where you live, or whether you have preexisting conditions.

label: left
tweet: The Affordable Care Act was signed into law 12 years ago today, thanks to the leadership of President Obama, President Biden, and so many others. This historic legislation provided access to health care to millions of Americans and protected those with preexisting conditions.

label: left
tweet: When we connect families and workers, students and small business owners, patients and health professionals, including mental health professionals, with high-speed internet, we connect folks to opportunity.

label: left
tweet: Through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we’re investing $65 billion to expand and modernize our nation's broadband infrastructure. We will lay thousands of miles of fiber optic cable and help millions of households lower their monthly internet bill.

label: left
tweet: Far too many of our fellow Americans cannot afford the cost of a high-speed internet plan, and too many others do not even have access to such a plan.The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will expand access to affordable broadband services to American households across the country.

label: left
tweet: Our rights and progress depend on fighting to protect the freedom to vote.Workers' rights, women's rights, immigration rights, LGBTQ+ rights, all of the rights we hold dear flow from that right.

label: left
tweet: Every American should be able to learn, work, worship, and gather without fear. Our duty is to do everything we can to protect all of our communities. Harm against any one of our communities is harm against all of us.

label: left
tweet: We are taking the necessary steps to ensure our communities are protected and supported, including HBCU students.

label: left
tweet: In light of the bomb threats against dozens of HBCUs and other faith-based institutions, we are sending a clear message:We will not be intimidated. We will do everything to protect our communities from violence and hate.

label: left
tweet: Oil prices are decreasing, gas prices should too. Oil companies should not try to pad their profits at the expense of hardworking Americans.

label: left
tweet: We cannot bridge the wage gap alone. It will truly take all of us working together. We can build a fairer, more efficient, and more equitable economy. An economy that works for women works for everyone.

label: left
tweet: Today, we celebrate our enduring friendship with Ireland. Happy St. Patrick’s Day!

label: left
tweet: Over the past year, we have taken significant action to address the gender wage gap.We passed the American Rescue Plan, which provided immediate relief to millions of women, and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that created good-paying jobs for many women in the workforce.

label: left
tweet: Today, on average, women working full time, year round make just 83 cents for every dollar a man makes. And for many women of color, the gap is even wider.Let’s build an economy that works for all women.

label: left
tweet: When I was in Poland, I met with U.S. and Polish service members, thanking them for standing with our NATO allies for freedom, peace, and security.The United States stands firmly with the Ukrainian people and in defense of the NATO alliance.

label: left
tweet: The Edmund Pettus Bridge is a stark reminder that we must always remain vigilant to safeguard freedom and democracy—that defending it will take all of us.

label: left
tweet: The greatest strength that we share is unity, especially at this moment as we stand together in defense of democracy.

label: left
tweet: When I was in the U.S. Senate, I sponsored legislation to ensure that our workplaces were safe. With the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act signed into law, we'll make our nation's workplaces safer and more just.

label: left
tweet: Protecting the freedom to vote is about protecting America’s democracy. That’s why Congress must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

label: left
tweet: President Biden has signed the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act of 2021 into law, ending forced arbitration in cases of workplace sexual abuse.This would not be possible without the survivors who spoke out and demanded change.

label: left
tweet: The American Rescue Plan invested more than $60 billion to help our nation’s small businesses recover from the pandemic.Roughly half of America’s workers either work for or run a small business. This funding has been critical to our recovery.

label: right
tweet: Promising Pathway Act increases innovation in clinical trial design and encourages sponsors to use real world data to ascertain the benefits of the drug without reducing the FDA’s standard of safety or effectiveness.

label: right
tweet: Promising Pathway Act requires FDA to use a rolling, priority review pathway to evaluate drugs intended to treat, prevent, or diagnose serious diseases. Provisional approval is granted to drugs demonstrating substantial evidence of safety & early evidence of positive outcomes.

label: right
tweet: Promising Pathway Act gives people with serious and life-threatening illnesses a fighting chance to receive timely access to innovative treatments in America—and patients are willing and wanting to take on the challenge.

label: right
tweet: FDA’s slow and overly burdensome regulatory pathways prevent patients with no treatment options and little time to wait from accessing a potentially life-saving drug—often driving them to OTHER countries for treatment. This is unacceptable.

label: right
tweet: FDA’s current failure to approve safe and effective treatments for devastating diseases means the difference between life and death for patients with ALS, Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy, Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s, childhood DIPG, and more.

label: right
tweet: As new and promising therapies for patients with serious and life-threatening disease advance, my Promising Pathway Act allows  to modernize its review pathways WITHOUT sacrificing FDA’s foundational role in ensuring safety and efficacy.

tweet: As a United States Senator, I wake up every day thinking I may be able to do something good for our country, and I go to bed most nights thinking that I have. It has been a great privilege to serve the people in Tennessee, as governor and in the United States Senate.

label: center
tweet: And, finally, please tell them that I wake up every day thinking I may be able to do something good for our country and that I go to bed most nights thinking that I have. Please tell them that it has been a great privilege to be a United States Senator.

label: center
tweet: Remind them that most of the rest of the world wishes they had our remarkable system of government and that the US Senate has been, and I hope continues to be, the institution that does more than any other to create broad agreements to solve great problems and unify our country.

label: center
tweet: And most of our politics is about disappointments in not reaching the high goals that we have set for ourselves, such as all men are created equal.

label: center
tweet: As the political scientist Samuel Huntington wrote, most of our arguments are about conflicts among principles with which most Americans agree.

label: center
tweet: That we are not perfect, but, as our Constitution says, we are always working to form a more perfect union.

label: center
tweet: I hope you will remind them that we live in a remarkable country with the strongest military, the best universities and 20 percent of all the money in the world for just 5 percent of the people.

label: center
tweet: On one screen are the tweets and acrimonious confirmation hearings. But on the other screen, senators are working together to strengthen national defense, national laboratories, national parks and the .

label: center
tweet: My reply is always the same: Please suggest to your students that they look at Washington, D.C., as a split screen television.

label: center
tweet: Invariably one teacher will ask, “Senator, what would you like us to tell our students about being a United States senator?”

label: center
tweet: My favorite time as a senator has been inviting onto the Senate floor American history teachers who are attending the academies that were established in legislation proposed in my maiden address.

label: center
tweet: Being a senator is more like bring a parade organizer. You pick the route, recruit the marchers, select the music and even pick someone else to be the drum major — and then you walk in the middle of the parade so the marchers don’t march into the ditch.

label: center
tweet: Being governor is like being Moses. To get something done, you say, “Let’s go this way.”

label: center
tweet: Some former governors don’t like being a senator. Not me. The jobs are just different. In both jobs you pick an urgent need, develop a strategy and try to persuade at least half the people you are right.

label: center
tweet: Why join the Grand Ole Opry if you don’t want to sing? And I guarantee you that if 15 or 20 Republicans and 15 or 20 Democrats in this talented body set out to change that practice, it would change.

label: center
tweet: And the behavior that needs to change first is for individual senators to stop blocking amendments of other senators. If you are opposed to something, you ought to vote no. Why stop the entire body from considering the amendment?

label: center
tweet: You don’t have to eliminate the filibuster to restore the Senate to its traditional role of working across party lines to solve big problems. We don’t need a change of rules. The Senate needs a change of behavior.

label: center
tweet: But it’s hard to accomplish something if you don’t vote on amendments. Lately, the Senate has been like joining the Grand Ole Opry and not being allowed to sing.

label: center
tweet: It doesn’t take a genius to figure out how to gum up the works of a body of one hundred that operates mainly by unanimous consent. Here’s my view: It’s hard to get here, hard to stay here, and while you’re here, you ought to try to accomplish something good for the country.

tweet: Throughout history, a leading characteristic of failed nations has been spending excessive amounts of borrowed money. China is on track to surpass the U.S. economically, militarily, and geopolitically. To keep America strong for years to come, we must address our debt crisis.

label: right
tweet: Debt and insolvency are major threats to our nation’s security and economic wellbeing. I introduced the bipartisan TRUST Act to help us change course—establishing rescue committees to examine each of our endangered federal trust funds and develop saving solutions.

tweet: Americans are struggling with high inflation. The Administration should never have spent massive amounts of COVID relief dollars when states were already flush with funds. That, coupled with the Federal Reserve’s inaction on rates, has only worsened our nation’s fiscal crisis.

tweet: So my message today is that when it comes to child care—one of the big budget items most working families have to navigate—the status quo isn’t working for the millions of parents who need child care and the providers who need to recruit and retain talented educators.

label: left
tweet: The reality is that when parents can’t work because of child care, that’s not just a problem for them—it’s one more position a small business can’t fill, it’s one less link in our supply chain moving things along, and ultimately it’s one more strain on our economy as a whole.

label: left
tweet: But then, COVID-19 hit.The pandemic decimated the child care system—causing an estimated 1 out of 10 providers to close doors, & a third of workers to be laid off or furloughed. And it would’ve been far worse if Democrats didn’t provide support in the American Rescue Plan.

label: left
tweet: Child care workers, who are most often women, & overwhelmingly women of color, earn, on average, $10.72 an hour, & rarely get benefits they need—like health care, paid leave, or retirement benefits. This makes it hard to retain high quality child care workers.

label: left
tweet: Before the pandemic, half of all Americans lived in a child care desert. Nationally, there are 5+ infants & toddlers for every 1 opening, & in rural areas, there are 9 kids for every 1 opening.And finding child care is even more challenging for parents of kids w/ disabilities.

label: left
tweet: In my state, child care costs more than college tuition, & nationally 4 out of 10 parents have gone into debt due to the cost of child care, & almost 3 in 10 have had to choose between paying for child care or paying rent. But the scope of the problem goes well beyond just cost.
